item.description: This article is an overview of TCP/IP protocol stack. I will cover in detail what happens when a request to, say, bakerst221b.

item.title: Basics ðŸ“š
item.description: VLAN VLANs (broadcast domains) provide a way to separate LANs on the same switch. VLANs don’t share broadcasts.

item.title: Basics ðŸ“š
item.description: Network Address Translation - mostly to map local IPs to public ones, but sometimes used to map between two public or local networks.

item.title: Ethernet
item.description: This is a protocol of TCP/IP suite, Data Link Layer. The first layer after physical layer is a data link layer and the protocol in use here is Ethernet II.

item.title: Kerberos
item.description: Intro Secure shell. Significant improvement over telnet for remote control (since telnet was not encrypting the connection).

item.title: SMB
item.description: Over TCP - 445 port Over NetBIOS API UDP - ports 137, 138 TCP - ports 137, 139 NBF (legacy) Powershell command + win reg for SMB 1,2,3.

item.title: SSH
item.description: Intro Secure shell. Common ports: 22. Structure ![photo_2021-02-16 11.58.08](images/photo_2021-02-16 11.58.08.jpeg) The Flow - Wanna talk

item.title: ARP
item.description: This article is about ARP protocol. It’s used to map IP addresses to physical (MAC) addresses.

item.title: IP
item.description: *This article is about IP protocol (v4, v6 and IPX). IPv6 Attacks mitm6. LDAPS? ntlmrelayx.py -6 -t ldaps://<IP> -wh fake.

item.title: TCP
item.description: This article collects the basics of TCP protocol. Its friend UDP (transport layer protocol as well) is faster but less reliable.
